projectAgiliza.name: Agiliza
projectAgiliza.description: A startup dedicated to the centralization and presentation of business data. I led the creation of the app, developing the interface that displays BI charts and managing authentication, user control and permissions.

projectMoorishville.name: Moorishville
projectMoorishville.description: Is a county in the United States for which I have worked as a freelancer. My most notable project for them was the development of a system for searching files in a local database.

projectNebula.name: Nebula Wear
projectNebula.description: Luxury apparel brand and e-commerce platform focused on creating a robust and scalable solution. I lead the technical team, guiding the development and applying our specialized skills in each area. My focus is to take this project to its full potential.

projectFunko.name: Funko Shop
projectFunko.description: Is the degree project of the Full Stack with Node.js course of Elbow to Elbow. Funko shop is an online store selling Funko products.

ux.title: UX-UI Course
ux.description: User interface design for mobile apps, focusing on UX/UI principles.

react.title: Front-End Developer with React
react.description: I learned how to build user interfaces with React's FrameWork.

sass.title: Sass course
sass.description: One of the most important CSS frameWorks today.

node.title: Full Stack with Node.js
node.description: I gained knowledge to build functional schemes and services, working both on the client side (Front-end) and the server side (Back-end).

alura.title: Full Stack with Java
alura.description: Bootcamp especially designed to train quality full stack developers with solid foundations and good coding practices.

FAQ1.title: Do you have a work permit in Spain?
FAQ1.question: Yes, I have a work permit and I am fully qualified to work in Spain and in the European Union.

FAQ2.title: What is your specialization?
FAQ2.question: Although I have Full Stack knowledge, I specialize in Front-End development, mainly with React, which is where I most enjoy applying my skills.

FAQ3.title: How long have you been working in web development?
FAQ3.question: I started self-studying in 2021 and joined the ORACLE ONE program in 2022, which gave me a more solid foundation and a clearer planorama and since then I have not stopped learning.

FAQ4.title: Do you have experience in agile methodologies?
FAQ4.question: Yes, I have worked with agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban. I also like to implement these methodologies in the collaborative projects I lead.

FAQ5.title: What type of project are you looking for?
FAQ5.question: I am looking for projects that are not only technically challenging, but also have a real impact on society, helping to improve people's lives.

FAQ6.title: Are you open to working remotely or hybrid?
FAQ6.question: Yes, I am totally open to continue working remotely, although I am also willing to work hybrid or face-to-face if the project requires it.

FAQ7.title: What has been your greatest professional achievement?
FAQ7.question: One of my greatest achievements was in my current job, when I was asked to improve a web application that was not meeting expectations: it was slow, not intuitive and not accessible. I was given the freedom to choose the most appropriate technologies and working with the Back-End team we managed to create a new web application that solved the problems presented by the previous one, significantly improving the experience of our customers.

FAQ8.title: Are you willing to learn new technologies if required by the project?
FAQ8.question: Of course! I am always willing to keep learning new technologies and to grow professionally.
